channel.title: Diablo II
channel.description: I know it is a very old game, but it brings back some great childhood memories. I pretty much grew up on the game whenever I got my first desktop and tower. I think the last time that I checked, I was level 98 or something on my Hammerdin.

item.title: Diablo II
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

ytuio9`:

I can’t find my old cd -.- I still have my Lord of Destruction disc but I can’t find the ‘vanilla’ game…

If you want to play it, just get the BattleChest, because it comes with a lot of stuff for a really cheap price.

EDIT: If anyone wants to play this game with me, just ask for my username here or send me a private message. I do play non-ladder on the U.S. East realm.

Read full topic

item.title: Diablo II
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I had that problem a few years ago. I had my expansion pack and disc 2 but no disc 1. If you still have your serial you could try torrenting both discs, or go out and buy a new one. The entire thing with the expansion is about $15.

Read full topic

item.title: Diablo II
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:6, topic:478014”]I never actually played diablo 2 as a kid but in anticipation of diablo 3 speljohan forced me onto d2 up until the second act I believe, I’ve played diablo clones and love them and wouldn’t mind getting into diablo 2 at some point

anyone interested in playing some games in the near future?[/quote]
My friend and I actually started back playing on new characters again.

Read full topic

item.title: Diablo II
item.dc:creator: @TheLetterQArousesMe TheLetterQArousesMe
item.description:
@TheLetterQArousesMe wrote:

My Mom’s friend got this and let me play, and I was hooked FAST. I was 6-7 and I ended up beating the game… Lol good memories.

Read full topic

im pretty sure this was the first game i ever played. my dad and I played it through LAN a lot and I loved it.
